node_info.name: kafkaTrigger
node_info.description: Consume messages from a Kafka topic

properties.name: topic
properties.description: Name of the queue of topic to consume from

properties.name: useSchemaRegistry
properties.description: Whether to use Confluent Schema Registry

properties.name: options
properties.description: Whether to allow sending message to a previously non exisiting topic

options.name: allowAutoTopicCreation
options.description: Whether to allow sending message to a previously non exisiting topic

options.name: autoCommitThreshold
options.description: The consumer will commit offsets after resolving a given number of messages

options.name: autoCommitInterval
options.description: The consumer will commit offsets after a given period, for example, five seconds

options.name: heartbeatInterval
options.description: Heartbeats are used to ensure that the consumer's session stays active
options.hint: The value must be set lower than Session Timeout

options.name: maxInFlightRequests
options.description: The maximum number of unacknowledged requests the client will send on a single connection

options.name: fromBeginning
options.description: Whether to read message from beginning

options.name: jsonParseMessage
options.description: Whether to try to parse the message to an object

options.name: parallelProcessing
options.description: Whether to process messages in parallel or by keeping the message in order

options.name: onlyMessage
options.description: Whether to return only the message property

options.name: returnHeaders
options.description: Whether to return the headers received from Kafka

options.name: sessionTimeout
options.description: The time to await a response in ms

subProperties.name: allowAutoTopicCreation
subProperties.description: Whether to allow sending message to a previously non exisiting topic

subProperties.name: autoCommitThreshold
subProperties.description: The consumer will commit offsets after resolving a given number of messages

subProperties.description: The consumer will commit offsets after a given period, for example, five seconds

subProperties.name: heartbeatInterval
subProperties.description: Heartbeats are used to ensure that the consumer's session stays active
subProperties.hint: The value must be set lower than Session Timeout

subProperties.name: maxInFlightRequests
subProperties.description: The maximum number of unacknowledged requests the client will send on a single connection

subProperties.name: fromBeginning
subProperties.description: Whether to read message from beginning

subProperties.name: jsonParseMessage
subProperties.description: Whether to try to parse the message to an object

subProperties.name: parallelProcessing
subProperties.description: Whether to process messages in parallel or by keeping the message in order

subProperties.name: onlyMessage
subProperties.description: Whether to return only the message property

subProperties.name: returnHeaders
subProperties.description: Whether to return the headers received from Kafka

subProperties.name: sessionTimeout
subProperties.description: The time to await a response in ms

notes.name: Notes
notes.description: Optional note to save with the node

notesInFlow.name: Display Note in Flow?
notesInFlow.description: If active, the note above will display in the flow as a subtitle

settings.note: Trigger nodes only have common settings (notes, notesInFlow)
